data.title: Robot Army
data.solution:
robot_cnt = 1
rate_per_robot = 2
n = int(input())
total_time_spent = 0
while (total_time_spent < n):   
    work_rate = 1 / rate_per_robot * robot_cnt       
    time_needed_for_1_robot = 1 / work_rate       
    if total_time_spent + time_needed_for_1_robot > n:
        break; 
    total_time_spent += time_needed_for_1_robot    
    robot_cnt += 1
print(robot_cnt)
data.statement:
A scientist is trying to create an army of robots. Each robot is able to build another robot. A robot working alone will take 2 days to finish another robot. When a robot is completed, this new robot will be put to work immediately to help build other robots. 

The rate of work is directly proportional to the number of robots. For example, 2 robots working together will only take 1 day to finish another robot, and 4 robots will only take half a day. Assume that they all work on a single robot at a time.

The scientist built the first robot himself and then went home with his family. If he returns in [[n]] days, how many robots would he expect to see? Assume that he returns at the end of the work day.

Example:

```
 Day 0-------Day 1-------Day 2---------Day 3--------Day 4-------Day 5
  |------------|------------|------------|------------|------------|
  R-------------------------R------------R-----R-------R----R----R
  --------------------------R------------R-----R-------R----R----R
  ---------------------------------------R-----R-------R----R----R
  ---------------------------------------------R-------R----R----R
  -----------------------------------------------------R----R----R
  ----------------------------------------------------------R----R
  ---------------------------------------------------------------R
```
If the scientist returns on: 
Day 2, he would see 2 robots. 
Day 5, he would see 7 robots.
data.inputDescription: integer [[n]] for the number of days until the scientist returns
data.outputDescription: integer [[r]] for the total number of robots the scientist expects to see when he returns
